datasetVariables.name: AESEV

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AESER

datasetVariables.description: Is this a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
datasetVariables.label: Serious Event
datasetVariables.name: AESER

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66767

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEACN

datasetVariables.description: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: "DRUG WITHDRAWN", "DOSE REDUCED", "DOSE INCREASED", "DOSE NOT CHANGED", "UNKNOWN" or "NOT APPLICABLE".
datasetVariables.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: AEACN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEACNOTH

datasetVariables.description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: "TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED".
datasetVariables.label: Other Action Taken
datasetVariables.name: AEACNOTH

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEREL

datasetVariables.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include "NOT RELATED", "UNLIKELY RELATED", "POSSIBLY RELATED", "RELATED". Controlled Terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable.
datasetVariables.label: Causality
datasetVariables.name: AEREL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AERELNST

datasetVariables.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE".
datasetVariables.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: AERELNST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEPATT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT".
datasetVariables.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
datasetVariables.name: AEPATT

datasetVariables.name: AESCAN

datasetVariables.description: Was the serious event life threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AESOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AETOXGR

datasetVariables.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE). datasetVariables.label: Standard Toxicity Grade

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEENRF

datasetVariables.description:
Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point (RFSTDTC) and a discrete ending point (RFENDTC) of the trial.
Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: AEENRF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

modelClassVariable.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

priorVersion.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.description:
Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AEENTPT.
Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: AEENRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEENTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description of date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: AEENTPT

description: An events domain that contains data describing untoward medical occurrences in a patient or subjects that are administered a pharmaceutical product and which may not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49562, 2018-06-29)
label: Adverse Events
name: AE
